features: POWERFUL CORDLESS SUCTION: Two cyclonic air streams for incredible suction and long-lasting filter and motor life.
LIGHTWEIGHT AND PORTABLE: Detachable hand vacuum weighs just 2.8 lbs.
2 POWERFUL WAYS TO CLEAN: Handle above-floor messes with the detachable hand vacuum or use the versatile floor nozzle for quick bare floor cleanups.
DOCKING STATION: Offers upright storage and accessibility.
CLEANTOUCH DIRT EJECT: For easy, hands-free debris disposal.
XL DUST CUP: To tackle big jobs.
DEEP-CLEANING ACCESSORIES: Crevice tool for hard-to-reach places and scrubbing brush for stuck-on dirt.
LITHIUM-ION POWER: Lithium-ion battery technology ensures reliable power and performance.
EASY TO MAINTAIN: Maintenance is simple with an easily removable and washable filter.
WHAT'S INCLUDED: Shark Ultracyclone 2-in-1 Handheld Vacuum, Passive Floor Nozzle, Crevice Tool, Scrubbing Brush & Docking Station.
body.description: The Shark Ultracyclone System is a 2-in-1 cordless vacuum that fuses two cyclonic air streams for powerful suction and long-lasting motor life. It includes a versatile floor nozzle for quick bare-floor cleanups, CleanTouch dirt ejector, lithium-ion battery, two deep-cleaning attachments, and convenient storage dock for cleaning on the go. Perfect for homes, cars, and dorm rooms.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars BEST THING EVER
reviews.reviewText: I had a different Shark handheld vacuum that I used for cleaning up after my kids, but I killed it after a few years. I knew I shouldn't keep it plugged in all the time, but who can remember to unplug it as soon as it's done charging? The suction was great and I loved it, but another thing was the charge would only last 10 minutes at the most.I got rid of that one and started searching for a replacement. I wanted one with powerful suction and with a lithium-ion battery, so I could charge it whenever I want and not have to worry about unplugging it right away.I was hoping to get one around $50, but came across this. It was $149... Way more than I wanted to spend. :( But I got this because it had everything I wanted, plus it's a stick vacuum!Oh my gosh. I've had this vacuum for 2 months now, and every time I use it, I tell my husband how much I love it! It's just that awesome! I use it as a stick vacuum most of the time to clean up after my kids. I can easily get all the food and crumbs they drop under the table and chairs, without moving the chairs! I also use it in the living room to clean up more crumbs from their snacks on the carpet and couch. I still need my upright vacuum (also a Shark) to deep clean the carpets, but this does a pretty amazing job too! I love how it's so light-weight and cordless, so it's perfect for quick cleaning when I don't want to get my big vacuum out. The charge lasts so long too! It has never died on me and I go all over the house with it!But after I bought mine, the price dropped to $119! :( Ugh! But I'm still glad I bought it when I did, because with kids and pets, I really needed it!Update 11/30/2022:I've had this vacuum for almost 6 moths now, and still love it!! It works great and I also use it to clean my mini van. It gets so much tiny dirt from the floorboards that I can't even see! My kids like to use it around the house too. :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great power and easy to use - especially with pets - takes forever to charge though
reviews.reviewText: We have 5 large dogs that roam the entire house (including longer haired ones like German shepherds, labs and goldens) + a small animal room with bunnies, Guinea pigs, ferrets, etc. Needless to say, there’s a lot of dirt, hair and bedding everywhere when we go to clean daily. This thing works amazingly. It really picks up all the dirt, sand and dog hair with no issues. The container where it stores all the mess may seem small but it’s enough space to get my living room, hallways, second living room/office space, dining room and kitchen before emptying it. And I’ve never had an issue with it clogging due to pet hair. Only problem I have is the suction part is right in the middle, so if you’re just going over the floor quickly, it won’t get the corners or around round objects good. You’ll have to take it apart to be the smaller handheld portion to get those spaces. And it takes quite a long time to charge so I recommend leaving it plugged in every time you’re not using it. Other than that, it’s definitely worth buying it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Makes vacuuming almost fun
reviews.reviewText: Very light and powerful. Use on floors and carpets. Fills the little chamber with dirt - amazing how much is on the ground that’s not visible. Unbalanced though with the stand. Have to prop it up. Maybe add weight to the bottom. Still worth it to pick up and run around every few days.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Replaced my fullsize vacuum with this for most jobs
reviews.reviewText: This little vacuum is so easy to maneuver, I feel like it would be a great vacuum for children to use (though, it's pretty tall so unsure they'd actually be able to use it.) I can whip this around the baseboards and corners quickly without tiring my wrist -- I usually turn to this vacuum over my heavier duty stick vacuum, which doesn't fit under as many spaces. I also feel like I bash my other vacuum into furniture/baseboards more often than this, and it's so bulky that I often scratch the walls. This one is so lightweight I don't feel bad swinging it around the room quickly for impromptu cleanups throughout the day. The bin is awkward to empty -- I have two dogs and I have to dig my fingers around in the bin to get their hairballs out, but it has great suction and is super versatile for handling the mass amounts of hair. I also don't like how the charging stand doesn't hide the charging cable. I love the stand, but hate the wire. I don't often review products but I feel like this review may resonate with some potential buyers. It's a little pricey to me (I would have preferred if it as <$80), but I assume the price point is why the suction/quality is so high.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Decent little vacuum
reviews.reviewText: I just got this & had to use it right away! For positives; It is easy to maunuaver, lightweight, and looks nice on stand. It sucked up my dog's hair & dust bunnies pretty well. I do like it has 2 attachments. As for negatives; it takes 6 hours to charge 100% and the battery only lasted me 20 mins! For being a Shark vacuum, the suction isn't impressive and it has terrible battery life! I am debating whether to keep it or not, just based on that. It didn't last me to do my master bed room & master bathroom & they aren't very big. I also wish you could attach the different attachments on the longer tube instead of just attaching them to the little hand held vacuum. I bought it because it was $100 which is a good deal for it.

Mi primera impresión fue una decepción, había probado otras aspiradoras Shark e inicialmente sentí que esta era desechable. Sin embargo, después de probarla me pareció una gran compra, es sumamente ligera y la batería es suficiente para limpiar un departamento pequeño sin que se acabe la pila. Tiene buen poder de succión, suficiente para mi que tengo un Pomerania que deja pelitos por todos lados. Los accesorios son útiles y me parece genial que incluya la base, así es posible tenerla parada y también se pueden acomodar ahí los accesorios. El color es bonito y es fácil vaciar el depósito. Se puede inclinar fácilmente y girar, lo que es muy útil para llegar debajo de los muebles.Ahora, es una buena aspiradora económica y sirve para su objetivo, pero si buscas algo tipo Dyson esta aspiradora deja que desear, ya que no tiene luz ni rodillo, pero eso no afecta su objetivo, que es aspirar bien.

reviews.reviewTitle: I really love this vacuum for wood flooring and linoleum
reviews.reviewText: I really like the size its so compact. Its a powerful little machine. Love that the start button doesn’t have to be held the whole time you’re using it. It has its own stand bery compact, easy to use. Not good cleaning the dogs bed or carpets though. Its my only issue with it. Otherwise I love it. Fits easily under most things for cleaning. The vacuum brush isn’t heavy duty but if you’re using it on tile, hardwood or linoleum its fantastic.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pretty good for a simple floor vacuum
reviews.reviewText: It’s not the strongest suction but is great for a quick clean up. I bought it for our motorhome and it works well for that. I’ve used it to clean my car and was impressed. For the money it’s pretty good.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works well and so light and maneuverable.
reviews.reviewText: For quick cleanups this is so much nicer than a big heavy vacuum. I’m short and find most upright vacuums heavy and hard on my shoulders. This one is very light but also does a great job picking up dirt. Might not work that well for serious carpet cleaning but great for small carpet cleanups and on hard floors. I love it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Suction not good after a few months
reviews.reviewText: I have had this vacuum for a year and very disappointed that for the past few months the suction is not good. I always have to remove the lower section to pick up debris. Frustrating after paying so much for this vacuum. Not worth the money
